title: Cause of Increase in HCFCs in Stratosphere

content.question: <math alttext="H C F Cs" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HCFCs</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> were originally introduced as a solution to help phase out the use of <math alttext="C F Cs" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CFCs</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following most likely contributed to the increased levels of <math alttext="H C F Cs" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HCFCs</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> in the stratosphere over the past 30 years?

choices.label: Conversion of <math alttext="C O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="H C F Cs" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HCFCs</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> in the troposphere
Reduced albedo in the Arctic because of climate change
Leaking of refrigeration and air-conditioning units

content.answer: Leaking of refrigeration and air-conditioning units
